alert.note: Alert for Lamar; Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 2:53PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Marion and central Lamar Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 253 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Tremont to 7 miles northwest of Columbus AFB. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Vernon, Sulligent, Hackleburg, Detroit, Beaverton, Lamar County Airport, Weston, Crews, Bedford, Gattman, Henson Springs, Shottsville, Lamar County Public Lake, Rankin Fite Airport, Star, Byrd, Pine Springs, Bexar and Pigeye. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
